column4: for a windows user that is ready to do something new (because current windows install is bogging down), is wubi a poor choice?  I'm not personally familiar with wubi.
My fear is wubi will be slow.  It is running w/in Windows, ya?
k, I'll start w/Live CD and if it looks good to him, I'll help resize part and dual boot it.
if you can make a live USB, it will be much faster than a CD, plus you can save stuff to it.
